intro: Metteniusa nucifera, commonly known as the nutmeg tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Banda Islands in Indonesia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The tree produces a unique fruit known as the nutmeg, which contains the valuable spice called nutmeg inside a hard, woody shell. The plant is also known for its essential oils, which are extracted from the seed and used in perfumes and traditional medicine. Due to its economic importance, Metteniusa nucifera has been heavily cultivated and is now found in various tropical regions around the world.
